MS MCQs

    Virtualize resources in the cloud - Virtualization for networks

    »

    1. What is the primary reason for placing Azure resources in separate network security groups (NSGs)?

      To perform load balancing between the resources in the NSGs.

      To allow multiple NSGs to share a network interface adapter (NIC).

      To prevent an application that crashes on a host in one NSG from affecting resources in the other NSGs.

      To apply different firewall rules to each set of resources.


    2. Azure supports VNet peering for VNets in the same region, and global VNet peering for VNets in different Azure regions. What is the purpose of VNet peering?

      To connect VNets so together so that they function as one network.

      To isolate traffic in one VNet from traffic in the other.

      To conserve memory by reducing the size of the network routing tables.

      To ensure that each VNet has its own network security group.
